title: datalad publish hangs indefinetely while pushing when it has no permission?
body:
we were playing with @seldamat with multi user local setup and tried to publish into "--shared=group" repository from another user.   

As you can see original git complaints quickly and to the point.  But we are hanging there forever:

```shell
yohtest@smaug:~/sub-001$ git push origin master
Counting objects: 3, done.
Delta compression using up to 16 threads.
Compressing objects: 100% (3/3), done.
Writing objects: 100% (3/3), 314 bytes | 0 bytes/s, done.
Total 3 (delta 1), reused 0 (delta 0)
remote: error: insufficient permission for adding an object to repository database ./objects
remote: fatal: failed to write object
error: unpack failed: unpack-objects abnormal exit
To /mnt/scrap/tmp/yourstudy/sub-001
 ! [remote rejected] master -> master (unpacker error)
error: failed to push some refs to '/mnt/scrap/tmp/yourstudy/sub-001'
```
```shell
yohtest@smaug:~/sub-001$ datalad -l debug publish --to=origin 
[DEBUG  ] Resolved dataset for publishing: <Dataset path=/home/yohtest/sub-001> 
[DEBUG  ] Resolved input path arguments: [] 
[DEBUG  ] Evaluating 1 dataset publication candidate(s) 
[DEBUG  ] Attempt to publish 1 datasets 
[DEBUG  ] Using existing Git repository at /home/yohtest/sub-001 
[DEBUG  ] Testing for changes with respect to 'master' of remote 'origin' 
[DEBUG  ] Since no paths provided, comparing commits 
[DEBUG  ] Running: ['git', '-c', 'receive.autogc=0', '-c', 'gc.auto=0', 'annex', 'wanted', '--debug', 'origin'] 
[DEBUG  ] Running: ['git', '-c', 'receive.autogc=0', '-c', 'gc.auto=0', 'annex', 'wanted', '--debug', 'origin'] 
[INFO   ] Publishing <Dataset path=/home/yohtest/sub-001> to origin 
[DEBUG  ] Obtain remote annex info from 'origin' 
[DEBUG  ] Running: ['git', '-c', 'receive.autogc=0', '-c', 'gc.auto=0', 'annex', 'sync', '--debug', '--no-commit', '--no-content', '--no-pull', '--no-push', 'origin'] 
[DEBUG  ] Attempt to push '['master', 'git-annex']' to sibling 'origin' 
```
